    for other fields of study.

_examples.MICRODATA:
Change a Flat Tire
  About 
    
    
  $20
  About 30 minutes
  Necessary Items:
  Spare tire
  
    Lug wrench
    
  
  Jack
  
    Wheel wedges
    
  
  
    Flares
    
  
  
    Preparation
    
    
      
      
        
        Turn on your hazard lights and set the flares.
      
      
        
        You're going to need space and want to be visible.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Position your wheel wedges in front of the front tires if a rear tire is flat, or behind the rear tires if a front tire is flat.
      
      
        
        You don't want the car to move while you're working on it.
      
    
  
  
    Raise the car
    
    
      
      
        
        
        Position the jack underneath the car, next to the flat tire.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        
          
        
        Raise the jack until the flat tire is just barely off of the ground.
        
          
        
      
      
        
        It doesn't need to be too high.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Remove the hubcap and loosen the lug nuts.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Remove the flat tire and put the spare tire on the exposed lug bolts.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Tighten the lug nuts by hand.
      
      
        
        Don't use the wrench just yet.
      
    
  
  
    Finishing up
    
    
      
      
        
        Lower the jack and tighten the lug nuts with the wrench.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Replace the hubcap.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Put the equipment and the flat tire away.
_examples.PRE-MARKUP:
Change a Flat Tire
  About $20
  About 30 minutes
  Necessary Items:
  Spare tire
  Lug wrench
  Jack
  Wheel wedges
  Flares
  
    Preparation
    
      
        Turn on your hazard lights and set the flares.
      
      
        You're going to need space and want to be visible.
      
        
          Position your wheel wedges in front of the front tires if a rear tire is flat, or behind the rear tires if a front tire is flat.
        
        
          You don't want the car to move while you're working on it.
        
      
    
  
  
    Raise the car
    
      
        
        Position the jack underneath the car, next to the flat tire.
      
    
    
      
        
        Raise the jack until the flat tire is just barely off of the ground.
        
      
      
        It doesn't need to be too high.
      
    
    
      
        Remove the hubcap and loosen the lug nuts.
      
    
    
      
        Remove the flat tire and put the spare tire on the exposed lug bolts.
      
    
    
      
        Tighten the lug nuts by hand.
      
      
        Don't use the wrench just yet.
      
    
  
  
    Finishing up
    
      
        Lower the jack and tighten the lug nuts with the wrench.
      
    
    
      
        Replace the hubcap.
      
    
    
      
        Put the equipment and the flat tire away.
_examples.RDFA:
Change a Flat Tire
  About 
    
    
  $20
  About 30 minutes
  Necessary Items:
  Spare tire
  
    Lug wrench
    
  
  Jack
  
    Wheel wedges
    
  
  
    Flares
    
  
  
    Preparation
    
    
      
      
        
        Turn on your hazard lights and set the flares.
      
      
        
        You're going to need space and want to be visible.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Position your wheel wedges in front of the front tires if a rear tire is flat, or behind the rear tires if a front tire is flat.
      
      
        
        You don't want the car to move while you're working on it.
      
    
  
  
    Raise the car
    
    
      
      
        
        
        Position the jack underneath the car, next to the flat tire.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        
          
        
        Raise the jack until the flat tire is just barely off of the ground.
        
          
        
      
      
        
        It doesn't need to be too high.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Remove the hubcap and loosen the lug nuts.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Remove the flat tire and put the spare tire on the exposed lug bolts.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Tighten the lug nuts by hand.
      
      
        
        Don't use the wrench just yet.
      
    
  
  
    Finishing up
    
    
      
      
        
        Lower the jack and tighten the lug nuts with the wrench.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Replace the hubcap.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Put the equipment and the flat tire away.

_properties.descriptionZh: 与amount一起使用，说明金额对应的币种，例如美元，人民币，使用3个字母的 ISO 4217 格式
_properties.rdfs:comment:
The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.

Use standard formats: ISO 4217 currency format e.g. "USD"; Ticker symbol for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for Local Exchange Tradings Systems (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".
_properties.rdfs:label: currency

_properties.rdfs:comment: The upper value of some characteristic or property.
_properties.rdfs:label: maxValue

_properties.rdfs:comment: The lower value of some characteristic or property.
_properties.rdfs:label: minValue

_properties.rdfs:comment: The date when the item becomes valid.
_properties.rdfs:label: validFrom

_properties.rdfs:comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.
_properties.rdfs:label: validThrough

_properties.descriptionZh: 定量值或属性值节点的值。 对于定量值和货币金额，值的推荐类型是“数字”。 对于属性值，它可以是“Text”，“Number”，“Boolean”或“StructuredValue”。
_properties.rdfs:comment:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.


For QuantitativeValue and MonetaryAmount, the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
For PropertyValue, it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
_properties.rdfs:label: value

_pTree.descriptionZh: 货币数量或范围，用于描述固定金额（例如50美元）、金额范围（如银行账户存款额度范围）或工资的价值等。推荐使用PriceSpecification（价格明细）类别来描述报价和发票的价格。
_pTree.rdfs:comment: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use PriceSpecification Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.
_pTree.rdfs:label: MonetaryAmount

_properties.descriptionZh: 该项的一个附加类型， 通常用于从外部词典中向微数据语法添加更加具体的类型。它表示事物和事物本身所属的类之间的关系。在RDFa语法中, 对多类型最好使用‘typeof’属性这样的本地RDFa语法. Schema.org 工具对额外类型的理解较弱，特别是外部定义的额外类型。
_properties.rdfs:comment: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.
_properties.rdfs:label: additionalType

_properties.descriptionZh: 描述的子属性。 用于消除与其他类似项之间歧义的简短描述。 其它属性（特别是名称）的信息对于消歧义可能是必要的。
_properties.rdfs:comment: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.
_properties.rdfs:label: disambiguatingDescription

_properties.rdfs:label: identifier

_examples.MICRODATA:
Mom's World Famous Banana Bread
  By John Smith,
  May 8, 2009
  
  This classic banana bread recipe comes
  from my mom -- the walnuts add a nice texture and flavor to the banana
  bread.
  Prep Time: 15 minutes
  Cook time: 1 hour
  Yield: 1 loaf
  Tags: Low fat
  
    Nutrition facts:
    240 calories,
    9 grams fat
  
  Ingredients:
  - 3 or 4 ripe bananas, smashed
  - 1 egg
  - 3/4 cup of sugar
  ...
  Instructions:
  
  Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Mix in the ingredients in a bowl. Add
  the flour last. Pour the mixture into a loaf pan and bake for one hour.
  
  140 comments:
  
    
    
  
  From Janel, May 5 -- thank you, great recipe!
  ...

_properties.rdfs:comment: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details.
_properties.rdfs:label: mainEntityOfPage

_properties.descriptionZh: 潜在的与之搭配的动作，它描述了一个理想化的动作，在这个动作中，这个东西会起到“对象”的作用。
_properties.rdfs:comment: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.
_properties.rdfs:label: potentialAction

_properties.rdfs:comment: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.
_properties.rdfs:label: sameAs

  Professor
  
    
      20341 Whitworth Institute
      405 N. Whitworth

_pTree.rdfs:comment: The most generic type of item.
_pTree.rdfs:label: Thing

_sourceAck.rdfs:comment: This element is based on the work of the Financial Industry Business Ontology project (see http://www.fibo.org/schema for details), in support of the W3C Financial Industry Business Ontology Community Group (http://www.fibo.org/community). Many class and property definitions are inspired by or based on http://www.fibo.org.
_sourceAck.rdfs:label: FIBO

descriptionZh: 货币数量或范围，用于描述固定金额（例如50美元）、金额范围（如银行账户存款额度范围）或工资的价值等。推荐使用PriceSpecification（价格明细）类别来描述报价和发票的价格。

isDomainOf.descriptionZh: 与amount一起使用，说明金额对应的币种，例如美元，人民币，使用3个字母的 ISO 4217 格式
isDomainOf.rdfs:comment:
The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.

Use standard formats: ISO 4217 currency format e.g. "USD"; Ticker symbol for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for Local Exchange Tradings Systems (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".
isDomainOf.rdfs:label: currency

isDomainOf.rdfs:comment: The upper value of some characteristic or property.
isDomainOf.rdfs:label: maxValue

isDomainOf.rdfs:comment: The lower value of some characteristic or property.
isDomainOf.rdfs:label: minValue

isDomainOf.rdfs:comment: The date when the item becomes valid.
isDomainOf.rdfs:label: validFrom

isDomainOf.rdfs:comment: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.
isDomainOf.rdfs:label: validThrough

isDomainOf.descriptionZh: 定量值或属性值节点的值。 对于定量值和货币金额，值的推荐类型是“数字”。 对于属性值，它可以是“Text”，“Number”，“Boolean”或“StructuredValue”。
isDomainOf.rdfs:comment:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.


For QuantitativeValue and MonetaryAmount, the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
For PropertyValue, it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
isDomainOf.rdfs:label: value

isRangeOf.rdfs:comment: The base salary of the job or of an employee in an EmployeeRole.
isRangeOf.rdfs:label: baseSalary

_examples.MICRODATA:
Change a Flat Tire
  About 
    
    
  $20
  About 30 minutes
  Necessary Items:
  Spare tire
  
    Lug wrench
    
  
  Jack
  
    Wheel wedges
    
  
  
    Flares
    
  
  
    Preparation
    
    
      
      
        
        Turn on your hazard lights and set the flares.
      
      
        
        You're going to need space and want to be visible.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Position your wheel wedges in front of the front tires if a rear tire is flat, or behind the rear tires if a front tire is flat.
      
      
        
        You don't want the car to move while you're working on it.
      
    
  
  
    Raise the car
    
    
      
      
        
        
        Position the jack underneath the car, next to the flat tire.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        
          
        
        Raise the jack until the flat tire is just barely off of the ground.
        
          
        
      
      
        
        It doesn't need to be too high.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Remove the hubcap and loosen the lug nuts.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Remove the flat tire and put the spare tire on the exposed lug bolts.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Tighten the lug nuts by hand.
      
      
        
        Don't use the wrench just yet.
      
    
  
  
    Finishing up
    
    
      
      
        
        Lower the jack and tighten the lug nuts with the wrench.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Replace the hubcap.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Put the equipment and the flat tire away.
_examples.PRE-MARKUP:
Change a Flat Tire
  About $20
  About 30 minutes
  Necessary Items:
  Spare tire
  Lug wrench
  Jack
  Wheel wedges
  Flares
  
    Preparation
    
      
        Turn on your hazard lights and set the flares.
      
      
        You're going to need space and want to be visible.
      
        
          Position your wheel wedges in front of the front tires if a rear tire is flat, or behind the rear tires if a front tire is flat.
        
        
          You don't want the car to move while you're working on it.
        
      
    
  
  
    Raise the car
    
      
        
        Position the jack underneath the car, next to the flat tire.
      
    
    
      
        
        Raise the jack until the flat tire is just barely off of the ground.
        
      
      
        It doesn't need to be too high.
      
    
    
      
        Remove the hubcap and loosen the lug nuts.
      
    
    
      
        Remove the flat tire and put the spare tire on the exposed lug bolts.
      
    
    
      
        Tighten the lug nuts by hand.
      
      
        Don't use the wrench just yet.
      
    
  
  
    Finishing up
    
      
        Lower the jack and tighten the lug nuts with the wrench.
      
    
    
      
        Replace the hubcap.
      
    
    
      
        Put the equipment and the flat tire away.

  About

  About 30 minutes
  Necessary Items:

    Lug wrench

        Position your wheel wedges in front of the front tires if a rear tire is flat, or behind the rear tires if a front tire is flat.
      
      
        
        You don't want the car to move while you're working on it.
      
    
  
  
    Raise the car
    
    
      
      
        
        
        Position the jack underneath the car, next to the flat tire.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        
          
        
        Raise the jack until the flat tire is just barely off of the ground.
        
          
        
      
      
        
        It doesn't need to be too high.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Remove the hubcap and loosen the lug nuts.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Remove the flat tire and put the spare tire on the exposed lug bolts.
      
    
    
      
      
        
        Tighten the lug nuts by hand.
      
      
        
        Don't use the wrench just yet.
      
    
  
  
    Finishing up

isRangeOf.descriptionZh: 执行操作的物料成本估价
isRangeOf.rdfs:comment: The estimated cost of the supply or supplies consumed when performing instructions.
isRangeOf.rdfs:label: estimatedCost

isRangeOf.descriptionZh: Invoice类型实体此次需要支付的最小金额
isRangeOf.rdfs:comment: The minimum payment required at this time.
isRangeOf.rdfs:label: minimumPaymentDue

isRangeOf.descriptionZh: 由资产减去负债计算得到的个人净资产
isRangeOf.rdfs:comment: The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.
isRangeOf.rdfs:label: netWorth

rdfs:comment: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use PriceSpecification Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.
rdfs:label: MonetaryAmount
